triplets: Vegetable from the cabbage family, cultivated for its edible green flower heads and stalks
Eating raw or cooked, in salads, soups, stir-fries, steaming, boiling, or roasting
Vegetable plant; mainly florets and stalks are consumed
Green, sometimes with purplish tints depending on variety
Vegetable crops, healthy diet, culinary ingredients
Approximately 0.1–0.5 kg per head depending on size
Typically 15–30 cm depending on variety and growth
3–5 days after harvest when stored in refrigeration; can last longer if frozen
